intro: Argostemma longisepalum, commonly known as the long-sepal argostemma, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Rubiaceae. It is native to Southeast Asia and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that typically bloom in clusters. The plant features opposite, ovate leaves with serrated edges, and its stems are often hairy. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. The flowers are pollinated primarily by insects, contributing to its ecological significance in its native habitat.
